revised_title: An Account of an Extraordinary Agitation of Water in a Small Lake at Closeburn
tldr: This article describes an extraordinary agitation of water in a small lake at Closeburn, in the Shire of Dumfries, observed by Sir Thomas Kilpatrick. The water exhibited unusual motion, with currents running in opposite directions and a lack of wind as a possible contributing factor. The phenomenon recurred the following day but with less intensity.
